title: dependence_plot with binary dtypes
body:
LOVE the package. Thanks for all your hard work.

I did run into a minor issue. It seems if I run the following

```python
shap.dependence_plot("feature", shap_values, X)
```

then I get the error

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-97-43ba60d687bc> in <module>()
      1 # You need to add "astype(float)" to compute the interaction_index:
----> 2 shap.dependence_plot("AllAttributes~SecPhoneTypeCode", shap_values, X_sample)

/automnt/toolbox/users/santon/conda-envs/santon/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/plots.py in dependence_plot(ind, shap_values, features, feature_names, display_features, interaction_index, color, axis_color, dot_size, alpha, title, show)
    152     # guess what other feature as the stongest interaction with the plotted feature
    153     if interaction_index == "auto":
--> 154         interaction_index = approx_interactions(ind, shap_values, features)[0]
    155     interaction_index = convert_name(interaction_index)
    156     categorical_interaction = False

/automnt/toolbox/users/santon/conda-envs/santon/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/plots.py in approx_interactions(index, shap_values, X)
    254             for j in range(0, len(x), inc):
    255                 if np.std(val_other[j:j + inc]) > 0 and np.std(shap_ref[j:j + inc]) > 0:
--> 256                     v += abs(np.corrcoef(shap_ref[j:j + inc], val_other[j:j + inc])[0, 1])
    257         interactions.append(v)
    258 

/automnt/toolbox/users/santon/conda-envs/santon/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/lib/function_base.py in corrcoef(x, y, rowvar, bias, ddof)
   3157         warnings.warn('bias and ddof have no effect and are deprecated',
   3158                       DeprecationWarning, stacklevel=2)
-> 3159     c = cov(x, y, rowvar)
   3160     try:
   3161         d = diag(c)

/automnt/toolbox/users/santon/conda-envs/santon/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/lib/function_base.py in cov(m, y, rowvar, bias, ddof, fweights, aweights)
   3067             w *= aweights
   3068 
-> 3069     avg, w_sum = average(X, axis=1, weights=w, returned=True)
   3070     w_sum = w_sum[0]
   3071 

/automnt/toolbox/users/santon/conda-envs/santon/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/lib/function_base.py in average(a, axis, weights, returned)
   1143 
   1144     if returned:
-> 1145         if scl.shape != avg.shape:
   1146             scl = np.broadcast_to(scl, avg.shape).copy()
   1147         return avg, scl

AttributeError: 'float' object has no attribute 'shape'
```

My features are a combination of dtypes:

```
>>> X.dtypes.unique()
array([dtype('int64'), dtype('bool'), dtype('float64')], dtype=object)
```

So I tried this and it worked:

```python
shap.dependence_plot("feature", shap_values, X.astype(float))
```
